para: It was six a.m and the alarm rang loudly. I looked at the clock and thought, damn, another day begins. You were still asleep, smiling softly as the morning light touched your face. The quiet room felt warm and safe, and I wanted to stay like that forever.

I filled out the form at the office, writing slowly to avoid mistakes. Life feels not the same as it did before, when laughter came easily. There was an exchange of glances between us, silent but powerful. I thought about somebody that i used to know, a blonde who once walked beside me in the rain. Those memories returned suddenly, like a song I had forgotten how to sing.

The room was quiet except for the sound of my heartbeat echoing in my ears. Through the camera lens, the world seemed distant yet painfully real. I whispered the words no tears left to cry, hoping they would keep me strong. A single tissue lay crumpled on the desk, a sign of battles already fought. I kept going in circles, searching for answers that never appeared. Your hand brushed against mine, and in that fragile touch I felt hope. It was only us in that moment, and the silence between us was louder than any song.
